text: How To Play
[Supply ConTest] is an Alliance-based event
child: which takes place every other day from {hour:21}:00 to {hour:22}:00.

text: After the event starts
child: the transport plane will fly around the map along the 4 Silos. There are 2 rounds.

text: During the flight
child: the transport plane will drop off supplies randomly.

text: Commanders can march on supplies. The first arriving commander receives the supplies and then begins delivering them to the nearest Ruin held by their Alliance.
Transport and Interception
Transport unit debuffs: Reduced march speed
child: reduced unit ATK and HP. Unable to speed up or withdraw during transport.

text: You may march against a non-ally commander to intercept the transportation.
If the interceptor wins the battle the following takes place:
The transport unit will retain 10% of the initial supplies (calculated as 1 when less than 1) and will continue marching to its original destination.
The interceptor obtains the remaining supplies
child: but it also adopts the debuffs during delivery.

text: Event reward
When the transport troop arrives at a Ruin
child: every Alliance member will be rewarded with supplies.

text: Supplies need to be claimed on the Alliance channel. The reward will become invalid if the claim time is exceeded.
Tips
You can see the flight route of the transport plane and the supply spots that have not yet been transported on the mini map.
You can destroy an enemy commander's base to dismiss the transport troop.
No additional battles will take place after the unit has been plundered.
The more supplies there are
child: the slower the march will be.

text: Transport supplies back to your Ruins to get rewards (rewards are sent to your mailbox)!
When the airdrop redemption ends
child: the remaining Airdrop resource box will be removed.

text: warhammer_guide_001
warhammer_guide_002
The refresh time starts at {hour:0}:00 and refreshes every 3 hours.
warhammer_guide_004
Commander
child: you need to join an Alliance and build your War Hall to rally against [Warhammer-4K].

text: warhammer_guide_006
warhammer_guide_007
Event Reward
warhammer_guide_009
warhammer_guide_010
warhammer_guide_011
warhammer_guide_012
Event time
[Warhammer battle] is a regular event
child: which lasts for 3 days once it begins.

text: The refresh starts at {hour:0}:00 and refreshes every 3 hours.
Event Participation
Commander
child: you need to join an Alliance and build your War Hall to rally against [Warhammer-4K].

text: Rally against and defeat the Warhammer to get points. You get 1 point for each Warhammer defeated.
The Attack Party should contain at least 2 members
child: and by the end of the rally or when the team is full
png: it will launch an attack on [Warhammer-4K].

text: Event Reward
After the number of Warhammer cumulatively killed by all Alliance member reaches the specified number
child: all Commanders in the Alliance can collect the chest in the interface

text: After the event ends
child: rewards will be sent to all alliance members' mail according to the ranking.

text: Join Attack Party
Each commander can collect rewards up to 50 times via joining the rallies other commanders start against [Warhammer-4K]
Overview
[Capital ConTest] is an Alliance-based event.
Alliances can compete for the [Capital] buildings in the center of the world map.
Stages
The Capital enters the Battle stage each on Sunday at {hour:10}:00.
Stage 1 {hour:10}:00 - {hour:11}:00
At this stage
child: the Alliance which continuously holds the Capital for 30 minutes will win.

text: Stage 2 {hour:11}:00 - {hour:11}:30
At this stage
child: the Alliance which holds the Capital for 15 minutes will win.

text: Stage 3 {hour:11}:30 - {hour:12}:00
At this stage
child: the Alliance which holds the Capital for 5 minutes will win.

text: Stage 4 After {hour:12}:00
At this stage
child: the Alliance which hold the Capital will win the game.

text: Notice: If a new Stage starts while the conquest timer is not finished
child: the countdown will continue. Only when a new Alliance gains control of the Capital
png: the rule of a new Stage will apply.

text: Battle Instructions
30% of the units damaged in Capital and Silo battles will be demoted directly.
When conquering the Missile Silos at the four corners of the Capital Area
child: if the Alliance holding the Missile Silos and the Alliance holding the Capital are opponents
png: the Silos will regularly launch missiles to attack the troops garrisoned in the capital. The damaged units will be demoted not sent to repair.

text: When your troops arrive at a building
child: if it is your Alliance
png: your troops will reinforce the building. If not
column7: you will fight against opposing Alliance.

text: Event reward
The Alliance leader who takes over the Capital will become the Capital leader.
Leaders can appoint officers
child: initiate Warzone-wide boost
png: send gifts
column7: change the name of the Warzone

text: During each [Capital ConTest]
child: the ranking and rewards for battles in the Capital and Silo are determined by kill points.

text: After an appointment
child: a cooldown timer begins. Other commanders can't be appointed to that post until the cooldown is complete.

text: MOD identity
MODs are experienced Commander who knows more about Top War
child: not a staff.

text: MOD's work
Answer commander's questions in chat channels and emails in time.
The first time of the Capital ConTest will be chosen by the commanders. During the first 10 days after the Warzone is opened
child: Commanders of level 20 and above will be able to vote for the desired start time. The option with the most votes will be the time of the Capital ConTest. If no commander voted
png: then the battle time will be at {weekhour:7
column7: 10}: Commander

text: Within 24 hours after the Capital ConTest ends
child: the leader is allowed to choose the time of the next Capital War. If the leader does not choose any in 24 hours
png: then the next capital war begins at {weekhour:7
column7: 10} Commander

text: The battle status time for the Capital depends on Commanders' voting result or the leader's choice.
Stage 1: within 1 hour after the battle status begins.
Stage 2: begins after stage 1 ends. Lasts for 30 minutes.
Stage 3: begins after stage 2 ends. Lasts for 30 minutes.
Stage 4: begins after stage 3 ends.
The [Supply ConTest] is an alliance-based event. Runs every other day for 1 hour.
The first opening time is selected by Commanders at level 20 and above. If no one votes
child: the event day starts at {hour:9}: 00.

text: After the first supply conTest is over
child: the leader chooses the start time of the next one. If there is no leader
png: Commanders will vote to choose the next start time. When no one chooses
column7: the opening time will start at {hour:9}:00 on the next round of event days.

text: When the supply conTest start time coincides with the time of the Cross-warzone War Prep. Stage and Battle Stage
child: the supply conTest will not be available.

text: When the airdrop redemption ends
child: the remaining Airdrop resource box will be removed.

text: Overview
[Silo Scramble] is an Alliance-based event.
Each Alliance can start a Scramble against any or all [Silo] on the World Map.
How To Play
The Silo Scramble lasts for 24 hours.
Your Alliance gains conquest time by conquering and holding one or any number of Silos.
An Alliance's rank is determined by the conquest time of the four Silos combined times.
Commanders may earn the Individual Score by holding Silos
child: killing opponents or Dark Forces.

text: Commanders who have reached the specified points can receive corresponding rewards.
During this event
child: you can get [Temporary Trap] by defeating "Dark Forces" on World Map. This item can only be used during the event. At the end of the event
png: any remaining [Temporary Trap] will be deleted.

text: Battle Instructions
At the beginning of the event
child: the Silo are taken by [Dark Legion].

text: Defeat [Dark Legion] to be able to conquer the Silo.
When your troops arrived at the buildings
child: if the conqueror comes from the same alliance as you
png: then your troops will reinforce. if the occupier doesn't belong to your Alliance
column7: then you will battle.

text: Event Reward
Alliance ranking rewards will be sent by mail after the event ends. Please do not leave the Alliance before the reward is sent
child: you will not gain alliance rewards.

text: Individual points rewards need to be collected in [Individual Reward] on the event tab
Individual Points
Individual points can be obtained by the following ways:
Conquer the Silo
Send troops to garrison the Silo to earn points every minute. You'll need to garrison for at least 1 min to earn points.
Fight other Alliances in Silo
Battles in the Silo are ranked based on killing points. Attacking and defending kill points are both credited.
During a rally
child: you will only get points if you kill the enemy. If you only participate in the rally but don’t kill the enemy
png: you will not get points.

text: Get Trap
During Silo Scramble
child: the "Dark Forces" on the World Map will randomly drop [Temporary Trap]. You will also earn points each time you obtain a Temporary Trap.

text: Use Trap
During Silo Scramble
child: using [Temporary Trap] and [Trap] in battles will earn you points. This is effective for all battles.

text: System Overview

1. Expeditions are carried out by each commander with the aim to assess their combat ability.

2. [Challenge] the enemy Boss of the current stage and get a reward after you win the battle for the first time.

3. In the battles
child: participating soldiers are automatically supplied. You won't lose your units even if you are defeated.\n\n4. In the battles
png:
participating heroes won't be affected by marching status.

5. You can view stage info for the current area on the Map.

6. The more stages you challenged
column7:
the harder it would be and the greater the reward.

7. You cannot challenge the same stage twice.

8. You can challenge different stages as many times as you need.

text: Daily Expedition

1. There will be different recommended heroes every week. Use them for daily expeditions to obtain higher CP point than heroes of the same attribute.\n\n2. Different heroes have different CP point according to their attributes. The higher the CP point
child: the more rewards you will get. When CP point reaches the aim of this level
png:
you can activate Buff: Indomitable and get additional rewards.

3. Select a hero to view the possible reward items.

4. Up to 3 heroes can be dispatched in daily expeditions.

text: Expedition Store
The Medals of Glory obtained from battles are used to buy Components
child: hero shards and other items in the Expedition Store. Reach higher levels to add purchase limit and unlock more items.

text: Rush
With the power of advanced technology
child: you can get a period of action reward immediately

text: Alliance Ranking: In cases where the points are the same
child: the ranking will be determined by the conquest time (down to seconds). If this count is the same
png: the ranking will be determined by the order of entry. The Alliance that entered the first Silo wins.

text: If you sent multiple troops to the same Silo at the same time
child: the points will be determined by one troop. Please send troops to different Silos for more points.

text: Feat
Alliance feat tasks need to be completed through the joint efforts of all members
You will get a medal for each feat task
Complete feat tasks and get medals to upgrade the Alliance level
Alliance level can unlock new Alliance badges
Rewards for each feat task can only be claimed once. Tasks that have been completed cannot be claimed again even if you join another Alliance
Alliance Defense
Only the leader and vice leader of the Alliance can register for participating in the Alliance Defense. To register
child: you should have atleast one completed Alliance Fortress.

text: After the event starts
child: there will be a giant Empire Mechanical Force near the Alliance Fortress. Tap Defense to jump to the Alliance Fortress.

text: The mechanical forces will attack the Alliance Fortress regularly
child: and members of the Alliance can send troops to defend in the Alliance Fortress.

text: During the event
child: defeat Dark Forces on the map to get special items to weaken the enemy or repair your Alliance Fortress. Items will be removed after the event.

text: When the Alliance Fortress durability drops to 0
child: the defense fails.

text: Garrison in the Alliance Fortress to defend it
child: weaken the enemy
png: and repair the Alliance Fortress will earn you specific points.

text: Ranking is listed based on the total points earned by all Alliance members in the Alliance.
A successful defense is when you win a battle. Failures won't be recorded to cleared waves. Alliance points can still be increased by kills and individual points even after a defeat.
During the defense period
child: new members cannot join the Alliance
png: and the Alliance Fortress selected during registration cannot be removed.

text: After the event
child: you need to manually claim the ranking rewards on the leaderboard tab
png: please claim it in time.

text: The rewards for defending waves and individual points need to be collected before the end of the event. Please collect it in time.
New members of the Alliance who have not participated in the defense event cannot claim rewards.
The Silo Scramble starts at {weekhour:2
child: 21} and lasts for 2 hours.

text: Points Calculation:
1. Every time you repair the fortress
child: you will get 6-10 individual points randomly. All individual points will be added to Alliance points.

text: 2. Every time you weaken the enemy
child: you can randomly get 2-5 individual points. All individual points will be added to Alliance points.

text: 3. The number of enemies defeated in each wave is the Individual Defense Points. All members in the Alliance fortress will get it as individual points. The more members participating in the defense
child: the more Alliance points will be obtained.

text: Requires Lv. 20 to participate in this event.
There will be a weakening progress for each wave of enemies. After the progress is full
child: the difficulty of the current wave will be lowered. The difficulty will be reset when the next wave spawns.

text: Overview
1. Matching stage:
One week before the battle begins
child: the system will match opponents based on their ranking points. 2 servers will be matched as opponents. Please view the server number of your opponent in the Event tab.

text: 2. Donation stage:
At the donation stage
child: Commanders can obtain Military Supplies in the individual points ranking rewards of the Arms Race. Military Supplies can be donated to the "Frontline Battlefield" located at the corner of the map. After the donation stage ends
png: the server that donates the most items to that "Frontline Battlefield" will get the initial ownership of that Frontline Fortress. (Each day at 16:00 (GMT)
column7: the system will remove the remaining Military Supplies in your inventory. Please donate in time).

text: 3. Prep Stage:
At the Prep Stage
child: if a server conquered a Frontline Fortress
png: the commanders of this server can teleport to the opponents server using the frontline fortress. (Commanders cannot interact with any objects in the opponents server at this stage)

text: 4. Battle stage:
At the Battle Stage
child: commanders of the 2 servers will attack and invade with the goal of conquering the opponents Capital. On the map
png: it is necessary to conquer the area Stronghold and obtain its ownership before moving to the area or interacting with other buildings in the area. And when attacking a new Stronghold
column7: you can only attack Strongholds of the nearby areas.

text: Frontline Fortress is a special fortress. It doesn't require conquest time to conquer it
child: and you can attack it even if you don't conquer the adjacent area. When conquered
png: your server will take over its ownership (will be counted in the number of conquered areas in the event tab)
column7: and you will be able teleport to the opponents server via it. Commanders cannot teleport to the cross-server area of their own Server
column8: they can only attack the enemies in the area.

text: Commanders can only dispatch troops after conquering at least one area adjacent to the Missile Launch Facility and Capital.
If a Server successfully conquered the opponent Capital
child: the Battle Stage will end and the server which conquered the opponent Capital will win.

text: If at the end of the Battle Stage
child: neither Servers conquered the opponents Capital
png: the Server with most conquered areas will win.

text: If the number of areas conquered by the two Servers is the same
child: the system will compare the sum of the final top ten commanders' kill points. The Server with higher points wins.

text: 5. Award stage:
At the Award Stage
child: commanders can collect rewards in the event tab based on their performance in the Cross-Server War. The rewards for Cross-Server War victory and killing ranking will be sent automatically.

text: Special Instructions
Some events are temporarily closed:
The Supply ConTest and World Boss will be temporarily unavailable at Preparation Stage and Battle Stage.
Alliance-related features are temporarily closed:
During the Battle Stage
child: all Alliance-related functions will be temporarily closed. Commanders cannot establish
png: join
column7: or quit Alliances
column8: nor can they make technological contributions.

text: Cross-warzone Chat:
The commanders of the two opposing Servers can chat in the Cross-server chat channel.
Strategic Retreat:
In the event tab
child: commanders can tap the "Strategic Retreat" button to return to their server. Once a commander uses Strategic retreat
png: the commander will lose half of the units
column7: so think carefully! In normal period
column8: Commanders can teleport in-between the 2 servers via the Frontline Fortress that they've conquered.

text: Abdication of Leader:
At the Battle Stage
child: if the Capital of a server is conquered by commanders of the other server
png: then the Leader of the conquered Capital will abdicate and the server will have no Leader until a new Leader is decided in the next Capital ConTest.

text: At the Battle Stage
child: Commanders of the 2 Servers will fight to conquer the Capital of the opposing Server. On the map
png: Commanders need to conquer the Fortress of an area first. When conquered the Fortress
column7: Commanders can move to this area and interact with objects in this area. Please note that you may only attack Fortresses located adjacent to your conquered area.

text: Frontline Fortress is a special fortress. It doesn't require conquest time to conquer it
child: and you can attack it even if you don't conquer the adjacent area. After occupying it
png: your server will hold it (will not be counted in the number of conquered areas in the event tab)
column7: and you will be able teleport to the opponents server via it. Commanders cannot teleport to the cross-server area of their server
column8: they can only attack the enemies in the area.

text: 2. Select a Battle Zone:
At the Selection Stage
child: the Warzone (Server) Leader can select a spawn area in Enemy's Battle Zone
png: and commanders will spawn at a random location in this area.

text: The Battle Zone is a hostile activity area for all commanders on your server to execute military operations.
The Leader can change the location of the Enemy's Battle Zone before the "Battle Zone Selection" Stage ends.
The Battle Zone selected by the Leader will only be announced during the Battle Stage.
At the Prep Stage
child: commanders will get ready for the upcoming war.

text: Commanders cannot move to the Enemy's Battle Zone at the Prep Stage.
At the Battle Stage
child: the main target is to attack the enemy's Capital and Ruins
png: and take over those facilities.

text: When the war begins
child: commanders can return from or go to the Battle Zone by using the "SVS" button on the Event panel or World Map

text: When entering the Enemy's Battle Zone
child: commanders will spawn in a random area in this Battle Zone. If you entered the Enemy's Battle Zone
png: you are only allowed to move their bases in this zone.

text: Please note the shield will break when entering the Enemy's Battle Zone.
Before the enemy’s choice of the Battle Zone in your Warzone is announced
child: your shield won't break if you are located in this Zone. After the announcement
png: if you move into this Zone
column7: your shield will break.

text: You cannot open Shields in the Battle Zone.
In the Enemy's Battle Zone
child: commanders can attack the enemy commanders and the Dark Forces
png: and gather in the resources tiles located in this area
column7: and the enemy commanders may attack commanders in this Battle Zone as well.

text: Holding the "Capital" and "Ruins" in the Enemy's Battle Zone gains you Warzone points.
Holding the Enemy's "Ruins" and "Capital" for a certain period of time
child: you'll take over the ownership of those facilities.

text: By taking over the ownership of facilies in the Enemy's Battle Zone
child: you'll gain points over time.

text: The Warzone Score are gained solely by holding facilities in Enemy's Battle Zone.
NOTE: Only SOME of the facilities will gain you Warzone points. Refer to the description for more details.
Individual points can be earned by holding Enemy facilities
child: killing enemy commanders (units)
png: and defeating the Dark Forces. Different facilities
column7: enemy units
column8: and Dark Forces grants different points.

text: Individual Score is the individual points that a commander earned
child: and it will not increase the Warzone Score.

text: At the end of the Battle Stage
child: the Server with the highest scores wins.

text: If the scores are the same
child: the server holding the enemy's Capital wins.

text: If both sides occupied the opposing Capital
child: the Warzone holding the most opposing Ruins wins.

text: If the numbers of ruins are the same
child: then the server with higher Individual Score (total score of Top 10) wins.

text: By the end of the Battle Stage
child: if the winner is holding the enemy’s Capital
png: the Leader of the losing Warzone will be dismissed. There will be no leader in this Warzone until a new leader is elected in the next Capital ConTest.

text: At the Reward Stage
child: rewards are given to commanders based on their performance. Please collect the reward on Event Panel. Also there will be a "Victory Reward" and your "Individual Ranking Reward"
png: which are sent to your mailbox.

text: Individual Ranking is ranked based on Individual Score from high to low
When returning from the Enemy's Battle Zone
child: commanders will not lose extra units in the base.

text: If you leave the Battle Zone on opposing server
child: you will have to wait for a specific period of time before you can go there again.

text: Each Warzone has a separated Individual Ranking. Rewards are sent by the end of the Battle Stage
Killing enemy units in Ruins
child: Silos
png: and the Capital will gain you more points than killing enemy units in their bases

text: When a high-level commander attacks low-level units
child: the points earned will decrease as the level gap increases. When the level gap is greater than 10
png: you will not get points (for instance
column7: if you are Level 80
column8: you won't earn points by killing Lv. 69 units)

text: If you took over the enemy's Ruins and Capital
child: the building will enter the "At peace" status and your enemy cannot attack these buildings. Your fellow commanders can send troops and garrison in the buildings to earn points.

text: When the "At peace" status ends
child: the building still belongs to you
png: but the enemy can attack it. The "At peace" status only triggers when you are taking over a building from your enemy

text: Warzone Exercise Rules
In Warzone Exercise
child: commanders can challenge opponents to earn points and win rewards.

text: Every day
child: you may challenge the Warzone Exercise for free for several times
png: and when the free challenges are used up
column7: you'll need to use the Exercise Pass to challenge again.

text: When challenging other commanders
child: you can gain points by winning in the battles
png: and you'll lose points if you failed. When being challenged by other commanders
column7: you won't gain points by winning in battles but you'll lose points if you failed.

text: Each round of Warzone Exercise lasts 5 days
child: from Monday to Friday. After the Exercise ends
png: rewards will be sent based on the ranking.

text: After each round of Warzone Exercise
child: your points will be reset and all Exercise Passes will be removed.

text: You need to challenge a player once or deploy a defensive formation at the begining of each round of Warzone Exercise
child: after which you will earn the initial points and ranking.

text: Theme of the Same Warzone Exercise
Each round of Warzone Exercise has different themes that requires different strategies
All-round development theme
By using the units provided by the system
child: you may use your heroes
png: and your attributes will be applied.

text: Specific hero theme
By using units and heroes provided by the system
child: only your attributes will be applied

text: Hunting Guild
In the Hunting Guild
child: you can obtain Treasure Map Pieces by completing guild quests. Put 9 pieces together to get a complete treasure map
png: and trigger 4 kinds of treasure events with different features.

text: Guild Task
The Hunting Guild will assign you a quest regularly. By completing the quest
child: you will receive a random number of Treasure Map Pieces. You can get up to 3 quests at the same time
png: and you can view the information of the next quest after completing or cancelling the current quest.

text: Repair Equipment

You found a broken mechanical treasure chest. A hunter told you that you could fix it with tech items to open it and get the treasure inside!\n    But be quick! If you fail to open for a period of time
child: it will start a self-destructing program and the tech items you used will also disappear along with it.

text: Treasure Wheel
You found a Roulette decorated with strange grooves. A hunter told you that if you put diamonds in it
child: it will spin and drop a random reward!\n    But be quick! The Roulette will start the self-destruct program soon after a while and disappear. However
png: you may keep the rewards you have received.

text: Treasure Guard
You provoked three Mechanical Treasure Guards. A hunter told you that you need to activate one of those Guards to defeat it
child: and all commanders can attack it after the activation. \n    After defeating the Treasure Guard
png: its summoner and all commanders who have attacked it will get rewards. But you will not get the reward if you fail to defeat it in time!

text: Treasure Store
You found an antique Treasure Store. According to the treasure hunters
child: you can buy rare items at a super discount here! All commanders can purchase items in it.\n    But be quick! After a period of time
png: the store will be closed. And also there are item quantity limits
column7: so first come first served!

text: Warzone Exercise (SvS) Rules
In Warzone Exercise (SvS)
child: commanders will be put into groups and compete with others from all warzones.

text: Every day
child: you may challenge the Warzone Exercise (SvS) for free several times
png: and when the free challenges are used up
column7: you'll need to use the Exercise Pass (SvS) to challenge again.

text: When challenging other commanders
child: you can gain points by winning in the battles
png: and you'll lose points if you failed. However
column7: you won't gain or lose points for being challenged by other commanders.

text: Each round lasts 2 days: from Saturday to Sunday
child: and rewards will be sent after each round ends.

text: The points are reset and the Warzone Exercise Pass (SvS) are removed by the end of each round.
At the beginning of each round
child: you'll need to challenge a commander or deploy your defense lineup to gain the initial points and ranking.

text: Warzone Exercise (SvS) Combat Rules
All commanders need to set up Army units
child: Naval units and Air Force units.

text: Units are provided by the system and it will not deploy units in your base.
You can only use corresponding heroes for each Unit Type
child: e. g.: You can only use Army-type hero for Army Units.

text: By saving current lineup
child: the current attributes will also be saved. If you need to change attributes
png: please set the defense lineup again.

text: The battle result determines your ranking. When challenging a higher ranked opponent
child: your rankings will be swapped if you win the battle. When challenging a lower ranked opponent
png: your rankings will remain the same regardless of the battle result.

text: For example: Commander A (ranked 10th place) challenged Commander B (ranked 1st place)
child: if Commander A wins
png: Commander A will become 1st and Commander B will drop to 10th. If Commander A loses
column7: the ranks will remain the same.

text: You may send your troops to the battle
child: including units you have sent for a march. But you cannot use units that are wounded/under training/destroyed.

text: Military Exercise will not cause a loss of units
Deploy your defensive troops or challenge an instructor (a PC) to get an initial ranking. Depending on the chronological order of the deployment or challenge
child: the earlier you completed deployment and challenge
png: the higher the ranking. Challenging an instructor will not count as an attempt.

text: 1. Development Stage:
After the Leader or R4 places the base of the basket (Alliance Command) in the alliance territory
child: completing the daily tasks will gain you the Easter Eggs points for Alliance Command Ranking
png: Individual Ranking and Alliance Ranking.

text: Alliance Command has 8 levels from Lv. 0 to Lv. 7
child: and there will be level reward for each level! Completing daily tasks is the only way to upgrade the Command.

text: 2. Battle stage:
There are several battle stages during the event. Commanders can view the start time of the next battle or the duration of this battle in the Battle Log panel.
In the Battle Stage
child: commanders can send troops to attack the Command of other Alliance. By winning the battle
png: you can take Alliance Command points from the opponent. The point earned is based on the level of the opponent's Alliance Command before the Battle Stage. There's a limit for points you can take from the Opponent
column7: once you reached the upper limit
column8: you'll no longer be able to gain more points. Earn more points for higher Alliance ranking!

text: Defeating the garrison in the Alliance Command will earn you Individual Points. Note: the points earned is based on the level of the opponent meaning you won't be able to gain points by defeating low level opponents.
In the Alliance Command panel
child: you'll be able to see a blue bar
png: which stands for the status of the Command. It will drop if you fail to defend the Command
column7: and when it drops to 0
column8: the level of the Command will be downgraded. Please remember to send reinforcements!!

text: 3. Reward:
Complete daily quests to gain the daily rewards. Don't forget to claim them everyday!!
Upgrade the Alliance Command to obtain level rewards
child: please collect them from event panel.

text: Gain more Individual points and Alliance points to get better ranking rewards. Rewards will be sent via mailbox after the event ends.
By the end of the event
child: if your Alliance Command remains at Lv. 7
png: you will also receive a perfect event award from your mailbox!

text: Story
The "Odinium Canyon" is a top-secret area in the Dark Empire
child: an area of danger and uncertainty. The Freedom League over took it and granted limited access to it. Only the "Discovery" and "Expedition" Squads have the access. The two Squads have been fighting against each other to dig up more information. A helping hand is always welcome...

text: Process

The War of Odinium is an alliance based SVS event. Process: Preview - Signing up for the War of Odinium (by Alliance Leader) - Picking up the participants (by Alliance Leader) - Matching (by system) - Preparation - Entering the battlefield - Beginning of the Battle Stage - End of the battle - Rankings
Sign-up
All eligible Alliances can sign up for the game in the Sign-up stage
If your alliance only manages to meet the requirements after the sign-up process begins
child: you'll not be able to participate in the game this time

text: Only the leader can sign up for the game and choose a time for the Alliance
The availability of each time slot is limited. You'll have to select another time if the time is not available
The leader needs to select confirm the Participants
child: or they will not be able to participate in the game

text: Participants
After the leader signed up for the event
child: the system will select Participants based on their Combat Power from high to low. The leader can edit the list.

text: Any Alliance member can be a Participant
child: but being a participant means you can't participate in this game for other Alliances.

text: The leader cannot select a new member as the participant after the leader has signed up for the game
Select participants before the timer hits 0. The Participant list will be locked when the match begins.
There will be a First team (30 members) and a Second team (10 members).
Matching
Before the battle stage begins
child: the system will match alliances that selected the same battle time

text: Alliances in the same point and power tier will be matched up
child: and alliances from different servers will be matched up first

text: If no opponent was found
child: you'll not be able to join the game this time

text: You'll be able to view your opponent's detail after the battle begins
Battlefield
When the battle begins
child: the First Team will enter the battle
png: and for each alliance
column7: up to 30 members will be able to join the Battlefield

text: After the battle has started
child: if there are still positions in the battlefield
png: members in the Second team can enter the battle as well.

text: There will be a prep time before the battle begins
child: commanders may enter the battlefield but you cannot attack others yet

text: The blue squad is the Discovery Squad (top) and the red will be the Expedition Squad. Commander bases will be placed in their start area.
The center of the battlefield is the Combat Area
child: with facilities
png: resources tiles and airdrop zone

text: Units - You cannot enter the battlefield if you have units under training
child: repairing
png: marching or damaged.

text: Marching - You cannot use March Speed-ups here.
Teleport - You can teleport to the Transfer Station you took over and your start area. It will cost your teleport opportunity
Teleport Opportunities - You'll gain Opportunities by taking over Transfer Stations
Attack - You can only attack bases in the Combat Area
child: and you cannot attack the bases in start area.

text: Repair Factory - No slot limit in this Factory. All damaged units will be sent to this Factory
child: speed-up costs you items/gems

text: Damaged units - All injured units will be recovered if you return to your base
child: no actual damage will be caused

text: Items - Only some items are allowed here
Features - Packs
child: hero list
png: tasks and Alliance are not available here

text: Airdrop
There will be airdrops from time to time
child: and Bomb Trucks as well.

text: Deal damage to the Bomb Truck and then whoever K.O. the truck will trigger the Explosion
The Bomb Truck will attack opponent's facility and deal damage to the garrison and repeal it
Score
The battle result will be decided by the total score. Alliance with higher total score wins the game
How to earn points: you can earn points by taking over facilities
child: gathering resources
png: killing rivals and looting airdrops

text: Alliance points: you can earn points by taking over facilities
child: gathering resources
png: and attacking the Bomb Trucks

text: Individual points: you can earn points by taking over facilities
child: gathering resources
png: killing rivals
column7: and attacking the Bomb Trucks

text: To take over a facility
child: you'll have to wait until the timer hits 0 and after that you'll be able to gain points and attribute bonus

text: You can teleport your base without withdrawing troops stationed outside your base. But you cannot teleport while troops are marching
Shield - The chaotic magnetic field in the Odinium Canyon damaged your shield. If you get back from the battlefiled
child: your shield will be activated again (if it's not expired)

text: Wade's skill "Battlefield Maintenance" will not take effect in the Battlefield
If you leave the battlefield
child: you will have to wait for a specific period of time before you can enter the battlefield again.

text: Commanders located in the spawn area (start area) can only attack the facilities in the battlefiled
child: and they cannot attack other commanders in this battlefield

text: When a participant leaves the Alliance
child: the leader of the Alliance can remove this commander from the list of the participants

text: About the Quests
The quests need to be completed by all members
Complete quests before the timer hits zero to claim rewards
child: the rewards will be removed after the timer hits zero.

text: Quests will be refreshed after the timer hits zero
child: and you won't be able to claim the rewards again.

text: Members can only claim the rewards after joining the Alliance for a certain period of time
About the Resources
After taking over the Ruin
child: the Alliance leader or R4 members can pick a resource type to spawn within the current ruin area

text: The selected Resource will spawn at a random location within the Ruin
The Resource tiles have different timer and storage capacity
The Resource tile will disappear after the storage drops to 0
The Resource tile will disappear after the timer hits 0
child: but it won't spawn or disappear when a commander is gathering resources from the tile

text: There is a limit on the number of Resource tiles spawned. If the number of current available Ruin area is less than is required
child: the number of tiles spawned will be decided by available Ruin areas.

text: Only the members of the holding alliance can gather resources from the spawned resource tile. But members from other Alliances can attack this tile.
You can only select one resource type to spawn for each round
About the Guards
After taking over the Ruin
child: the Alliance leader or R4 members can pick a type of Guard to spawn

text: The Guard will spawn at a random location within the Ruin
The Guards will remain in the Ruin for a limited time
child: and they'll leave after the timer reaches zero

text: No new Guard will appear after the Guard is defeated
Only the members of the holder of this Ruin can attack the spawned Guard
There is a limit on the number of Guards spawned. If the number of current available Ruin area is less than is required
child: the number of Guards spawned will be decided by available Ruin areas.

text: About the Scratch Card
The total number of Scratch Cards are decided by the number of your Alliance members
Each time a member gets a reward
child: the number of remaining rewards will be deducted from the prize pool

text: If you used up the scratches for this round
child: you'll have to wait for the next round

text: All draws are free
Ruins - How To Play
Ruins Campaign is a game mode for Alliances.
When a battle occurs in the Ruins
child: the battle rules for Player VS Player will apply. But 80% of the attacker's damaged units will be sent to the Repair Factory.

text: After garrisoning the ruins for 1 hour
child: the holder will take over the ruin and the ruin will enter a timed Truce period

text: After successfully taking over the ruin
child: the ruin may either gain Alliance members attributes or features.

text: You can attack any ruins
child: and there's a limit on Ruins you can hold at different levels
png: you cannot hold more ruins if you reached that limit.

text: The Alliance can hold up to 3 Lv. 1 Ruins
The Alliance can hold up to 2 Lv. 2 Ruins
The Alliance can hold up to 2 Lv. 3 Ruins
Attributes gained from the Ruins are effective only in your Warzone
After the truce period ends
child: if other Alliances failed to take over the ruin held by your Alliance within 24 hours
png: your Alliance will keep that ruin. If another Alliance is trying to take over the ruin
column7: this Alliance has to hold the ruin for 1 hour to finally take over the ruin.

text: When a ruin is "At war"
child: the attributes won't take effective and the feature will be deactivated

text: When the ruins are at peace and the Alliance is giving up the ownership of the ruin: If the remaining time for "At Peace" status is more than 1 hour
child: this status will last 1 hour after it's abandoned. If the remaining time for "At Peace" status is less than 1 hour
png: it will apply this remaining time after it's abandoned.

text: Also when an Alliance gives up the ownership of a ruin
child: members of this Alliance will not be able to attack/compete for this ruin in a certain period of time

text: By giving up the ownership of a Ruin
child: you cannot attack this ruin for a certain period of time regardless of the status of this ruin

text: Changing of the ownership will not reset the Cooldown of the ruin function
child: which means after the reset
png: if "Alliance A" used the function and later the ruin is taken by "Alliance B"
column7: "Alliance B" can use the function after the reset at {hour:0}:00.

text: About Special Effect Research Center
Special Effect Research Center is the core building to study the Elemental attributes.
After upgrading the Elements Lab
child: the HP (Elemental) of all units will also be increased. The HP (Elemental) related numbers will show in purple

text: After upgrading the Basic techs
child: the Elemental ATK of all units will also be increased
png: the units will be able to deal Elemental Damage.

text: After upgrading the Advance techs
child: the Elemental Attribute of all units will also be increased
png: the units will be able to deal Elemental Damage.

text: The Element Switcher allows you to buff units with different Elemental Attributes
child: but each type of unit will only apply 1 type of attribute at a time.

text: About Individual Score
How to Earn Individual Points
Holding the enemy's Capital can earn Warzone points
child: Individual points

text: Holding the enemy's Ruin can earn Warzone points
child: Individual points

text: Defeating Dark Forces in the Enemy's Battle Zone can earn Individual points
Killing enemy units at level 40 and above gains you Individual points
child: the higher the level
png: the higher the points.

text: All Individual points will not add to the Warzone Score
Battle Info
The SVS record will record the most of the interactions during the Battle Stage for you to review and reinforce your strategy.
By tapping on each area
child: you'll see a record of commander's activities and battles in the core facilities (Ruins
png: Missile Silos
column7: Capital).

text: Tap on the triangle on the edge of the map to switch to the Battle Zone
child: and view the record of activities in the Battle Zone.

text: The record will retain before the next SVS begins.
About the Medal Room
Meet specified requirements to unlock the Medals
child: and then you can promote your Medals
png: which takes time and materials.

text: Use the Speed-up items to boost the promotion and complete the process faster.
Unlocking and promoting the Medals will gain you the Merit EXP. Increase the Merit Level to earn great rewards!!
Ruins - How To Play
Ruins Campaign is a game mode for Alliances.
The first battle is a PvE battle
child: and if a commander made the finishing blow to the Ruins that reduced the Building HP to 0
png: the Alliance of this commander will gain the control of the ruins
column7: the status of this ruins will turn into "At Peace".

text: In the FIRST Ruins Campaign
child: the First Holder of the Ruins will get rewards ("First Holder Rewards")
png: which will be sent to all members of the Holding Alliance
column7: and a ranking rewards will be sent to all participants that attacked the ruins.

text: The First Holder Rewards and Ranking rewards are ONLY available for the first Ruins Campaign.
After taking over the Ruins
child: the Ruins may either gain Alliance members attributes or provide with special features.

text: Commander may attack any of the Ruins
child: but there's a limitation on the number of Ruins you can hold
png: which means you can't hold any more ruins of the same level if you reached the limit.

text: If the Finishing Blow Alliance can't hold more Ruins
child: then the ownership will be decided based on the Building HP Damage Ranking.

text: If there is still no eligible Alliance
child: the HP of the Ruins Guard in the Ruins will be restored and the status of this ruins will turn into "At War".

text: If the Building HP didn't drop to 0 in time during the "At War" status
child: the HP of the Ruins Guard will reset while the Building HP will remain.

text: Terms of Service (ER):
Only the units damaged during the Ranked SVS Battle Stage will be sent to the Emergency Repair
Only when there's no slot available in the Repair Factory (Base)
child: the damaged units will be sent to the Emergency Repair

text: The Emergency Repair only accepts Hall of Valhalla units
child: all other units will be sent to the Repair Factory (Base)

text: The Emergency Repair will despawn after the countdown drops to 0
child: and any unrepaired units will become "damaged"
png: which means you need to have the engineer fix and demote them

text: After the Emergency Repair despawns
child: any unrepaired units will become "damaged" and you'll have the resources it cost to repair them returned

text: Units damaged by attacking other commanders are not eligible for the Emergency Repair
A discount on Odinium cost in Emergency Repair (Emergency Repair only)
About Defense Setting
Garrison Settings
Garrison troops are set by the Commander. The saved garrison troops will NOT automatically be replenished by other units if set troops have been upgraded
child: out of base on march
png: lost in battle or demoted.

text: About Advanced Settings
The order troops enter battle is based on what the Commander has set for each type of force.
Each type of force will fight until it is completely zeroed out
child: then the next type of force will enter the battle.

text: Heroes for each force type are set up by the Commander.
If the hero is not in the base
child: the system will set other heroes who are not on the battlefield.

text: Alliance Droid

HOW TO PLAY

★Droid Types
1. There are many types of Droids
child: and each type grants different rewards. Position holders and the Alliance Leader should discuss carefully and decide which Droid you would like to activate.\n2. There are various difficulty options for each type of Droid. Defeating one level grants you the opportunity to challenge the next level
png:
and the max level is Lv. 5. Higher difficulty grants greater rewards!

★Droid Shards/Activating Droids
1. After a senior member has selected a Droid type
column7: the alliance members need to donate Droid Shards to boost the Droid deployment. Donating shards will grant you Donation Rewards as well!\n2. When the progress bar reaches maximum
column8:
a position holder or the leader needs to activate the Droid at the proper time!

★The Droid Battle
1. Commanders are required to cooperate with each other to defeat the Droid.
2. After each battle
column9: you need to wait for a while before you can enter the next one. Please manage your time wisely!\n3. After the Droid is defeated
column11: which lasts 30 minutes. You can attack it during this period and the damage still counts towards the damage ranking. Rewards will be sent by the end of this period. \n4. There's a time limit on the Droid. If you failed to defeat the Droid within the specific time
column12:
you won't be able to get the reward!

★Truce Period
1. After a Droid is activated and challenged
column13: the Droid will enter the "under maintenance" status
column15:
you can activate a Droid that is not under maintenance.
Lancer - Alpha: 12 hours
Lancer - Gamma: 2 days
Lancer - Delta : 4 days
Lancer - Epsilon: 7 days

Restriction
Newly joined members need to wait 24 hours before they can play this mode to get rewards.

text: Alliance Droid Support Program
★NOTE\nIf the Alliance activated a Droid that you couldn't defeat
child: the leader and position holders can request for support to attack the Droid.\n1. After the Droid is defeated under the support from other Alliances
png: all participating Alliance members will only receive the bottom-tier damage reward.\n2. Members are required to attack the Droid at least one time and deal damage to be able to get the damage reward.\n3. After the Droid is defeated under the support from other Alliances
column7: the Alliance can not activate the next Droid level.\n4. You can provide support 1 time/day

text: Eternal Land Tech Description
Except for the "Nextgen Tech"
child: other technologies ONLY take effect in the Eternal Land.

text: The "Nextgen Tech" takes effect on your server as well
child: which will boost the tech research.

text: Researching Techs requires a unique resource - the "Wonder Stones".
Please use the "Wonder Stone" in time. After this Eternal Land ends
child: the remaining "Wonder Stone" WILL BE REMOVED
png: you can't use it for the next Eternal Land.

text: Use the "Wonder Stone Tablet" to get Wonder Stones. NOTE: The "Wonder Stone Tablet" WILL BE REMOVED after the event ends.
Speed up tech research requires Speed-up items exclusive for Eternal Land
child: or you can also use gems to complete the research instantly

text: Complete tech research to gain rewards
If the commander is not online when the technology is completed
child: the reward will be sent to the inventory directly.

text: Every time the event starts
child: the Eternal Tech progress will be reset

text: kvk_tec_info_011
About the Radar
Radar Truck can be placed in the base.
Missions:
The number of missions is related to commander level. The higher the commander 's level
child: the more missons you'll see on the Radar Panel

text: There's a limit on missions each day
child: when there's no mission left
png: you'll have to wait till the next round

text: You'll see new missions each day in the mission pool
Radar Lv.:
The number of missions you can see is based on the radar level. The higher the radar level
child: the more missions you'll see.

text: Mission expiry
Each radar mission has an expiry date.
If the task is not completed within the effective time
child: the new task will show up.

text: Radar missions are refreshed every day at a fixed time.
Radar missions can be stored (the "Radar Mission Storage"). And there's a limit on the storage
Radar Operation Manual
1. Radar truck:
Radar Truck can be placed in the base.
The radar intercepts signals in the world and provides missions\n
2. Radar mission:
Radar missions grant a wide range of rewards
child: it's the fasTest way to level up

text: New missions generates over time. Increasing the radar level gives you additional missions as well.
If the mission is not completed in time
child: the radar will intercept a new mission and replace it\n

text: 3. Radar level:
Complete radar missions to get energy. When the energy is full
child: you'll see the upgrade button. Tap the button to upgrade radar

text: Upgrading the radar can add 1 mission obtained by the intercepting signal
Raising the radar level can reduce the waiting time for new missions
Raise the radar level may unlock more features\n
4. Radar signal
The radar signal strength is from 1 - 5
When completing the radar mission
child: there is a probability to increase the signal strength

text: When you have 5 signal bars
child: the next mission you intercept will be a 5-star mission
png: and the progress will reset to 1-bar

text: Tap the "Improve Signal" to use gems to increase 1 bar
child: it's free to improve for the first time everyday\n

text: 5. Radar defense system
This feature unlocks at Radar level 3
When all the radar missions are completed
child: and the next mission intercept is more than 10 minutes away
png: the radar will be intercepted by the Dark Legion
column7: a special defense mission is needed to fend them off

text: When the defense mission is completed
child: the signal will be improved to max
png: but the Dark Legion will only interfere with your signal one time per day.

text: If the given mission is not completed in time
child: Radar will remove the defense mission and you'll have to wait till the next one comes\n

text: 6. Mission reset
You may use Gems to reset a selected mission
Alliance Log
1. Number of records
The setting determines the maximum number of messages displayed in the alliance record section.
2. Full log menu
By enabling this option
child: you'll see the extended alliance records.

text: Priority selection
1. On the world map
child: when the march queue overlaps with a building:

text: Enable this feature to pick buildings appearing over other objects
Disable this feature to pick March Queue
Purchase confirmation
1. When using Gems to buy valuable items
child: you'll be asked to confirm the purchase.

text: Enable this feature to show the purchase confirmation panel.
Disable this feature to hide the purchase confirmation panel.
